"Generational Hater" Shaquille O'Neal Riles Up Fans After Downplaying Victor Wembanyama's Emphatic 40-Point Display Discuss Now Shaquille O'Neal Riles Up Fans After Downplaying Victor Wembanyama's Emphatic 40-Point Display - Image Source: Imagn Inside the NBA is back, and so is Shaquille Oâ€™Nealâ€™s trademark criticism of modern-day big men. On Wednesday night, his latest target was San Antonio Spurs phenom Victor Wembanyama , and his remarks drew mixed reactions from fans.
Ad Wembanyama lit up the Dallas Mavericks in the Spursâ€™ season opener, going off for 40 points, 15 rebounds and three blocks in under 30 minutes, outplaying a frontcourt that featured Anthony Davis and Dereck Lively II alongside No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg .
After the game, the Inside the NBA crew jokingly teased Shaq, saying that if there were an all-time draft, his ranking might take a hit, and that Victor Wembanyama would â€œcookâ€ him in a prime-versus-prime matchup given the French starâ€™s modern offensive skill set.
Ad Trending â€¢

Shaq, unfazed, fired back with a typically cheeky response:
"I'm not known for defense, you know what I'm known for? Eating French fries and French toast." Some fans found Shaqâ€™s comment amusing, while others called out the Hall of Famer for his familiar jabs.
â€œLol shaq is a generational hater when it comes to talking about any bigs,â€ one said . Ad â€œShaq would struggle to defend Wemby, but he's a guaranteed 2 PTs at 100% FG% when Wemby guards him. He's just too massive, strong, and talented. I'd take Shaq's consistency every time,â€ another commented . â€œHe's right because Embiid went for 70 on Wemby, but he's not guarding Wemby at all,â€ another added . Shaqâ€™s public â€œbeefsâ€ with other bigs, including Dwight Howard and Rudy Gobert, have long been part of his post-playing persona.
Ad Here are other reactions.
Jason Frakk @FrakkJason47117 Shaq's right. For a man who feasted on championships, a 40-point game is just an appetizer. Wemby's going to need to serve up a few more main courses to get on that legendary menu. Ad JBond @jbondwagon Bro loves to hate on young centers not named Nikola Jokic ðŸ˜­ Ad
Dallas_Amiker @DallasAmiker Shaq really be hating on French players first Rudy Gobert now Wemby Ad NBA legend compares Victor Wembanyama to Shaquille Oâ€™Neal While Shaq brushed off Victor Wembanyamaâ€™s explosive start to his third NBA season, his second having been cut short by a blood clot issue, another Hall of Famer, Kevin Garnett, offered a far more flattering comparison.
In Tuesdayâ€™s episode of â€œTicket & The Truth,â€ Garnett praised Wembanyama for redefining what it means to play center in todayâ€™s NBA.
Ad â€œHeâ€™s changing the way we look at the five position,â€ Garnett said (per Hoops Hype). â€œHeâ€™s changing how weâ€™re looking at the post position. Victor is bringing a different level of guard-slash-small forward to the big man position. â€œLike if you think about it, heâ€™s mixing finesse and force at the same time â€” or trying to Have you seen him in the preseason? Heâ€™s playing preseason games. He looks like KD and Shaq mixed together.â€ Victor Wembanyama's career is still just beginning, but after overcoming injury setbacks last season, the Spurs hope their young cornerstone can lead their resurgence in the Western Conference this year.
Ã— Feedback Why did you not like this content? Clickbait / Misleading Factually Incorrect Hateful or Abusive Baseless Opinion Too Many Ads Other Cancel Submit Was this article helpful? Thank You for feedback About the author John Ezekiel Hirro
John Ezekiel Hirro is an experienced NBA and WNBA journalist at Sportskeeda, with over five years in the field as a news correspondent, sports writer, and Editor-in-Chief. His sports writing career began in high school, where he garnered numerous accolades, including being named the national sports writing champion in 2016.
He earned his journalism degree from the University of Santo Tomas in the Philippines in 2024 and served as the Editor-in-Chief of The Varsitarian, the university's official student publication, for four yearsâ€”the longest in history.
A passionate basketball enthusiast, he became a fan of the OKC Thunder during the Russ-KD-Harden era. Russell Westbrook, his all-time favorite athlete, impressed him by stepping up as MVP after Kevin Durant's departure. His current favorite players include Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Jalen Williams and Chet Holmgren, who he believes are the future of the OKC franchise.
He excels in game analysis and rapid news story turnaround, drawing inspiration from the journalistic styles of Woj and Shams. He emphasizes thorough research to ensure accuracy in his articles. One of his most memorable moments is Russell Westbrook breaking Oscar Robertson's record with his 42nd triple-double and securing a 106-105 victory over the Denver Nuggets with a buzzer-beating 3-pointer. Outside of writing, he enjoys listening to music and creating Spotify playlists.
